fields.description: Implement Eucalyptus functionality to enable/disable data deduplication on NetApp flex volumes and also configure the schedule/policy for the operation.
fields.summary: CMode: Ability to configure de-duplication for NetApp

comments.body:
*Brief explanation of NetApp data deduplication and compression*

Data deduplication removes duplicate blocks, storing only unique blocks in the flex volume, and it creates a small amount of additional metadata in the process. Data compression is a software-based solution that provides transparent data compression. Deduplication is a process that can be scheduled to run when it is most convenient, while data compression has the ability to run either as an inline process as data is written to disk or as a scheduled process. When the two are enabled on the same volume, the data is first compressed and then deduplicated. Attached technical reports contain more detailed explanation of both these features in cluster-mode and 7-mode SANs

*New Eucalyptus configurable properties*

Introduced Eucalyptus cluster level configurable properties to manage data deduplication and compression settings: 
{noformat}
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enablededup	false
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.enablededup	NetApp: Enable or disable data deduplication for flex volumes. Value must be either true to enable or false to disable deduplication. Disabled by default. Data compression must be disabled before disabling deduplication

PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enablecompression	false
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.enablecompression	NetApp: Enable or disable data compression. Value must be either true to enable or false to disable compression. Disabled by default. Deduplication must be enabled before enabling data compression. Inline data compression must be disabled before disabling compression

PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enableinlinecompression	false
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.enableinlinecompression	NetApp: Enable or disable inline data compression. Value must be either true to enable or false to disable inline compression. Disabled by default. Compression must be enabled before enabling inline compression

PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.deduppolicy	<unset>
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.deduppolicy	NetApp: Name of the sis policy to be attached to flex volumes in cluster-mode only. If not configured, no default policy is used. Deduplication must be enabled before configuring the policy. Either the policy or the schedule can be configured for the flex volume. Both cannot be configured together

PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.dedupschedule	<unset>
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.dedupschedule	NetApp: Schedule string for the sis operation on flex volumes. If not configured, no default schedule is used. Deduplication must be enabled before configuring the schedule. Either the schedule or the policy can be configured for the flex volume. Both cannot be configured together. The format of the schedule string is: "day_list@hour_list" or "hour_list@day_list" or "-" or "auto". day_list specifies which days of the week the sis operation should run. It is a comma-separated list of the first three letters of the day: sun, mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat. Day ranges such as mon-fri can also be used. hour_list specifies which hours of the day the sis operation should run on each scheduled day. hour_list is a comma-separated list of the integers from 0 to 23. Hour ranges such as 8-17 are allowed. Step values can be used in conjunction with ranges. If "-" is specified, no schedule is set. The "auto" schedule string means the sis operation will be triggered by the amount of new data written to the volume.
{noformat}

Commit: 59d69478e1c9ece3bf9c31ff06795308094bdba4

*Verification*

Cluster mode: SSH to the Vserver and execute the below command after replacing the volume ID, look for "State", "Efficiency Policy Name", "Schedule", "Compression", "Inline Compression"
{noformat}
euca-vserver::> volume efficiency show -volume vol_63A64192

                  Vserver Name: euca-vserver
                   Volume Name: vol_63A64192
                   Volume Path: /vol/vol_63A64192
                         State: Enabled
                        Status: Idle
                      Progress: Idle for 00:04:25
                          Type: Regular
                      Schedule: -
        Efficiency Policy Name: euca-policy
        Blocks Skipped Sharing: 0
          Last Operation State: Success
  Last Success Operation Begin: Thu Nov 21 16:01:04 PST 2013
    Last Success Operation End: Thu Nov 21 16:01:04 PST 2013
          Last Operation Begin: Thu Nov 21 16:01:04 PST 2013
            Last Operation End: Thu Nov 21 16:01:04 PST 2013
           Last Operation Size: 0B
          Last Operation Error: -
              Change Log Usage: 0%
             Logical Data Size: 192KB
            Logical Data Limit: 50.00TB
          Logical Data Percent: 0%
                    Queued Job: -
  Stale Fingerprint Percentage: 0
                   Compression: true
            Inline Compression: true
            Constituent Volume: false
{noformat}

7-mode: SSH to the SAN and execute the below command after replacing the volume ID
{noformat}
eucanapc01> sis config /vol/vol_276F3B63
                                              Inline
Path                 Schedule     Compression Compression
-------------------- ------------ ----------- -----------
/vol/vol_276F3B63    auto         Enabled     Disabled 
{noformat}
DOC-1105 filed to track the documentation task

I've been unable to set the dedup policy likely something I'm doing wrong but re-opening to review. This was attempted while there were existing volumes in the cluster. Multi-cluster topology shown below. 
Thanks,
-M


Dedup is enabled: 

{code}

[root@e-11 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep PARTI00.storage | grep "dedup\|compre"
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.deduppolicy	<unset>
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.dedupschedule	<unset>
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enablecompression	false
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enablededup	true
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.enableinlinecompression	false

{code}

Then try setting dedup policy...
{code}
[root@e-11 ~]# euca-modify-property -p PARTI00.storage.deduppolicy='euca-policy'
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.deduppolicy	<unset> was <unset>

{code}
Fails, Error on CLC's cloud-output.log...

{code}
2013-12-06 13:36:33 ERROR 000000618 NetappInfo               | Data deuplication must be enabled before configuring deduplication policy
2013-12-06 13:36:33 DEBUG 000000618 Timers                   | com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceOperations$1@7feb0936: completed in 22 msec.

{code}

GIT_REPO	git+ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal#maint/3.4/testing
GIT_HASH	6aa8fece81b4adeeada0ecd64d0f6616f5f41cf6

10.111.1.126	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS UI]
10.111.5.17	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.19	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.33	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC01]
10.111.5.34	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[SC01]
10.111.5.41	VMWARE	ESXI-5.1	64	REPO	[NC01]
10.111.5.49	VMWARE	ESXI-5.1	64	REPO	[NC01]

Quick update, verified properties; "enablededup" and "deduppolicy" on cluster mode. Will update with remaining properties and 7mode shortly. 
Thanks,
-M
{code}
